Key Match Events: Isaiah Joe scored a career-high 31 points
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander outdueled Jalen Brunson with 39 points in just 29 minutes
The Thunder led by 14 points at the end of the first quarter
The Knicks' defense allowed the Thunder to shoot 53.9% from the field and 14-of-27 3-pointers
The Thunder extended their lead to as many as 30 points in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder wanted revenge after their 15-game winning streak was snapped in Cleveland
The Knicks lost for the fourth time in their last five games
Tom Thibodeau acknowledged the team's poor performance defensively
Post-Match Reflections: New York coach Tom Thibodeau took responsibility for the team's performance
Brunson led the Knicks with 27 points, but could not keep up with Alexander
Miscellaneous Highlights: Isaiah Hartenstein, who left the Knicks to join the Thunder, received a loud ovation and a video tribute
The Knicks' defense ranked 15th in the league, six spots below where they finished last season
